comments.body: Is it possible to pass in a connection id so one can launch a k8s pod in any GKE cluster?

I believe what you want can be accomplished by providing the project_id, location, and cluster_name of the cluster that you want to launch the pod in.

I checked and since the base KubernetesPodOperator doesn't use a hook, they have no need for a conn_id, therefore I don't know of a way to specify it.

I meant GCP connection, which stores service account key information. The default credential may not work for a (project, zone, cluster-name) tuple, think of starting a k8s pod in some GKE cluster in a different project.
Please update operator docstring to reflect latest changes.
